meanings.definition: The act or process of increasing in size or elevation.
meanings.sent1: The aggradations of the sand dunes were visible after the storm.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the river's aggradations caused the water level to rise.
meanings.sent3: The aggradations of toppings on the pizza made it look like a mountain.
meanings.sent4: Her achievements piled up like aggradations of success.
meanings.sent5: The aggradations of snow on the mountain made it sparkle in the sun.

meanings.sent1: The aggradations of knowledge come with consistent learning.
meanings.sent2: The aggradations of traffic during rush hour can be frustrating.
meanings.sent3: The aggradations of flavors in the soup made it taste better with each spoonful.
meanings.sent4: His savings account showed steady aggradations over the years.
meanings.sent5: The aggradations of colors in the sunset painted the sky beautifully.

meanings.definition: The result of adding layers or deposits over time.
meanings.sent1: The aggradations of sediment formed distinct layers in the rock.
meanings.sent2: The aggradations of paint on the canvas created a textured effect.
meanings.sent3: The aggradations of leaves on the ground made it hard to see the path.
meanings.sent4: The aggradations of dust on the shelves needed to be cleaned regularly.
meanings.sent5: The aggradations of memories in her mind created a rich tapestry of experiences.
